intro: Gumira herbacea, commonly known as the brittlestem gumira, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, opposite leaves. It produces clusters of white or pale yellow flowers that bloom throughout the dry season. The plant is often found in disturbed habitats and is used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
